page.title: 16Colvend: Population
page.content: The population of Colvend and Rockcliffe has steadily decreased in the last century. In 1900 there were over 60 children in the school.Today there are 10! One reason for this was that people had bigger families. Another reason was that in those days there were not many farm machines, so farm work had to be done by hand and needed more people. Today the tractor has replaced the horse and the combine harvester has replaced the sickle. Farm workers have always stayed in houses owned by the farm. Some old houses have been demolished,some have been modernised and are occupied while some are let as holiday houses. Many people who live here are old or retired, but some younger people are now coming here to live because they work in the tourist industry.
